data.meanings: certainty, surely, of a certainty, to be sure/certain, to ascertain, one who is certain.
data.sentence: The word يُوقِنُونَ comes from the root ي ق ن and is associated with the meanings: certainty, surely, of a certainty, to be sure/certain, to ascertain, one who is certain.

data.meanings: to swing, halt in a place, move, toss. Mankind, people, others, men.
data.sentence: The word لِلنَّاسِ comes from the root ن و س and is associated with the meanings: to swing, halt in a place, move, toss. Mankind, people, others, men.

data.meanings: to guide/direct to the way, take/follow right way/course, rightly guided/directed, a way/course/method/mode/manner of conduct. Gift.
data.sentence: The word وَهُدًى comes from the root ه د ي and is associated with the meanings: to guide/direct to the way, take/follow right way/course, rightly guided/directed, a way/course/method/mode/manner of conduct. Gift.

data.meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.
data.sentence: The word لِقَوْمٍ comes from the root ق و م and is associated with the meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.

data.meanings: Rahima - He favored, benefited, pardoned, or forgave him. To love, have tenderness, mercy, pity, forgiveness, have all that is required for exercising beneficence.. Tarhamu - He had mercy, pity, or compassion on him; he pitied or compassionated him much.. Arham - Wombs (singular) womb, i.e. place of origin. The receptacle of the young in the belly.. Ruhmun - Relationship, i.e. nearness of kin, connection by birth; relationship connecting with an ancestor. A connection or tie of relationship.. Rahman - it is active participle noun in the measure of fa'lan which conveys the idea of fullness and extensiveness.. Rahim - it is in the measure of fa'il which denotes the idea of constant repetition and giving.
data.sentence: The word وَرَحْمَةٌ comes from the root ر ح م and is associated with the meanings: Rahima - He favored, benefited, pardoned, or forgave him. To love, have tenderness, mercy, pity, forgiveness, have all that is required for exercising beneficence.. Tarhamu - He had mercy, pity, or compassion on him; he pitied or compassionated him much.. Arham - Wombs (singular) womb, i.e. place of origin. The receptacle of the young in the belly.. Ruhmun - Relationship, i.e. nearness of kin, connection by birth; relationship connecting with an ancestor. A connection or tie of relationship.. Rahman - it is active participle noun in the measure of fa'lan which conveys the idea of fullness and extensiveness.. Rahim - it is in the measure of fa'il which denotes the idea of constant repetition and giving.

data.meanings: Becoming perceptive, mental perception, having belief or knowledge, understanding, intelligence or skill, knowing, giving light, shining, illuminated, making manifest, evident and/or apparent.To behold/perceive/see/observe/watch.Opening the eyes and/or seeing (seldom used unless mental perception is conjoined)Clear sightThickness of anythingSense of sight, making or causing to see and/or have sight, eye-sight, eyes.Soft stones having some whitenessIntent or a hard glanceA watcher or guard, a lion.
data.sentence: The word بَصَائِرُ comes from the root ب ص ر and is associated with the meanings: Becoming perceptive, mental perception, having belief or knowledge, understanding, intelligence or skill, knowing, giving light, shining, illuminated, making manifest, evident and/or apparent.To behold/perceive/see/observe/watch.Opening the eyes and/or seeing (seldom used unless mental perception is conjoined)Clear sightThickness of anythingSense of sight, making or causing to see and/or have sight, eye-sight, eyes.Soft stones having some whitenessIntent or a hard glanceA watcher or guard, a lion.
